com.pb.sawdust.io

Class LineEntryInputStream

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.InputStream
      • java.io.ByteArrayInputStream
        • com.pb.sawdust.io.LineEntryInputStream
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class LineEntryInputStream
extends java.io.ByteArrayInputStream
    The LineEntryInputStream is a convenience class for constructing an input stream on a series of text "lines." The constructor takes a list of lines (without a line-separator) and will build input stream with the appropriate line-separator ending each line.

    • Constructor Detail

      • LineEntryInputStream

        public LineEntryInputStream(java.util.List<java.lang.String> lines)
        Constructor specifying the lines to build the input stream from. The line-separators will be added automatically, so they should be omitted from the input list.
        Parameters:
        lines - The lines to build the input stream from.
